data.title: Umaru Yar’Adua, President of Nigeria, Dies at 58
data.meta_description: Umaru Musa Yar’Adua, the first university-educated president of Nigeria, Africa’s most populous nation and one of the continent’s two biggest oil producers, has died. He was 58.
data.text:
Umaru Musa Yar’Adua, the first university-educated president of Nigeria, Africa’s most populous nation and one of the continent’s two biggest oil producers, has died. He was 58.

Vice President Goodluck Jonathan became acting president in February, three months after Yar’Adua left for Saudi Arabia to receive medical treatment. Jonathan will be sworn in as president today, the state-owned Nigerian Television Authority reported. Yar’Adua will be buried today at 2 p.m. in northern city of Katsina, his birthplace, Jonathan said in a statement.
